intro: Hoffmannseggella duveenii, commonly known as the Duveen's rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Hoffmannseggella duveenii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
